name: My Pain Catalan With Extra Tomatoes and Goat Cheese
description: This dish is inspired by the Catalan signature dish, but mustard can be substituted for garlic. It requires in-season tomatoes, so is best after a trip to the farmers market. The bread can be rubbed with garlic, or if that taste is too strong, can be spread with mustard.
recipeYield: 1 serving, or 2 servings as an appetizer
keywords: appetizer, side dish, healthy, high fiber, low cholesterol, nut-free, vegetarian, summer
recipeIngredient: 1 garlic clove, cut in half, or Dijon mustard to taste
1 large or 2 smaller ripe tomatoes in season
1/2 ounce goat cheese, crumbled or thinly sliced

recipeInstructions.text: If desired, toast the bread. Rub with the cut side of the garlic clove or spread with mustard. Cut one of the tomatoes in half and rub the cut side against the bread until the bread is nicely saturated with the juice and pulp of the tomato. Slice the remaining tomato and layer over the bread. Season to taste with salt, crumble the goat cheese on top, add a few torn basil leaves if desired and enjoy.
